news_header: Europe achieved an 8% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions in 2023, the highest one-year decline, making emissions 37% lower than in 1990.
news_text: According to the European Environment Agency, 2023 saw the highest climate emissions measured in one year, but greenhouse gas emissions decreased by 8%. This significant reduction is attributed to decreased coal usage and increased renewable energy sources, which now account for 24% of energy in Europe. By 2030, emissions are expected to fall to 4% of 1990 levels, with a target of a 55% reduction in the EU if new methods to cut emissions are not found.
